variable.name: Primary Disease
variable.description: The main disease(s) for which the participant has been asked to donate a sample for study

variable.name: Gender
variable.description: Participant's gender as Male or Female
variable.comment: Note: A single gender discrepancy has been detected when comparing data of version 2 to version 1, please regard this current version (2) as the correct one.

variable.name: IGHV
variable.description: IGHV is mutation status of the immunoglobulin heavy chain variable region. When the DNA sequence homology of CLL tumor is less than 98% compared to reference, it is designated as "mutated". Homology >98% is considered "unmutated." IGHV mutation status is a CLL prognosis marker; IGHV mutated status is associated with good prognosis.

variable.name: ZAP70
variable.description: ZAP70 is CLL prognosis marker and positive expression is associated with poor prognosis. ZAP70 expression level is measured by flow cytometry and the cutoff score is 24%.

variable.name: Trisomy 12
variable.description: Trisomy 12 is measured by FISH cytogenetic analysis. Cutoff score is 2%. Trisomy 12 is a neutral prognosis marker.

variable.name: Del13qhet
variable.description: Del13qhet is measured by FISH cytogenetic analysis of CLL tumor. Del13qhet is a chromosome 13q deletion in one allele. Cutoff score is 7%. Del13q is one of the most common chromosomal abnormalities in CLL and is associated with better prognosis.

variable.name: Del13qhomo
variable.description: Del13qhomo is measured by FISH cytogenetic analysis of CLL tumor. Del13qhomo is a deletion of the 13q region in two alleles. Cutoff score is 7%. Del13q is one of the most common chromosomal abnormalities in CLL and is associated with better prognosis.

variable.name: Del11q
variable.description: Del11q is measured by FISH cytogenetic analysis of CLL tumor, and is associated with poor prognosis. Cutoff score is 5%.

variable.name: Del17p
variable.description: Del17p is measured by FISH cytogenetic analysis of CLL tumor. The deleted region includes TP53, and is associated with poor prognosis. Cutoff score is 8%.
